poem:
Title: "Waking in the Tide of News"

Morning unfolds history,
brushed into life by a newspaper's whisper.
Sails jitter on Hormuz's mirror,
regional ghosts echoing ancient sea-verses.
U.K.'s shipping eyes cautiously blink,
while Fujairah's sand holds its breath.
The Revolutionary Guards, they dance,
Irish jigs on turbulent waters,
Threaded in the hushed rhythm of disruption,
This the serenade of unsettled seas,
this our coffee-blackened morning.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Vessel reportedly seized by ‘regional authorities’ in strait of Hormuz A vessel has been seized by “regional authorities” in the strait of Hormuz, 50 nautical miles off the coast of the United Arab Emirates, it has been reported. The United Kingdom Maritime Trade Operations (UKMTO) agency said in a post on X that the incident had taken place north-east of Fujairah. Iran’s state news agency IRNA later said that its Revolutionary Guards had seized the". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
